page.title: 16Sir Frederick Gibberd
page.content:
{Sir Frederick Gibberd}was a famous architect who designed{Harlow New Town after the Second World War. He designed air raid shelters during the War.
{Harlow New Town}was built to re-house people from North London, which had been badly bombed during the{Blitz.}
{Sir Frederick}wanted people to have pleasant houses to live in. He designed them in interesting clusters rather than in rows.
He bought a bungalow in Harlow in 1956. It had been a smallholding and he decided to build a beautiful garden
His favourite foods included tripe and onions, egg and bacon and Lady Gibberd's home made ice cream.
